opendial.bn.nodes

Class ChanceNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.nodes.BNode
      • opendial.bn.nodes.ChanceNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<BNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProbabilityRuleNode

    public class ChanceNode
extends BNode
    Representation of a chance node (sometimes also called belief node), which is a random variable associated with a specific probability distribution.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 20:28:23 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChanceNode

        public ChanceNode(java.lang.String nodeId)
        Creates a new chance node defined by the identifier. The default probability distribution is then a probability table.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the node identifier
        Throws:
        DialException - if the distribution is not well-formed

      • ChanceNode

        public ChanceNode(java.lang.String nodeId,
          ProbDistribution distrib)
        Creates a new chance node, with the given identifier and probability distribution
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the unique node identifier
        distrib - the probability distribution for the node
        Throws:
        DialException - if the distribution is not well-formed

        Sets the probability distribution of the node, and erases the existing one.
        Parameters:
        distrib - the distribution for the node
        Throws:
        DialException - if the distribution is not well-formed

      • addProb

        public void addProb(Value nodeValue,
           double prob)
        Adds a new value with associated probability to the node. The probability must be independent of other nodes, and the distribution must be a probability table.
        Parameters:
        nodeValue - the node value
        prob - the associated probability

      • addProb

        public void addProb(Assignment condition,
           Value nodeValue,
           double prob)
        Adds a new value with associated probability, given a specific value assignment for the conditional nodes. The distribution must be a probability table.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition for which the probability is value
        nodeValue - the new value
        prob - the associated probability

      • removeProb

        public void removeProb(Value nodeValue)
        Removes the probability for the given value
        Parameters:
        nodeValue - the node value to remove

      • removeProb

        public void removeProb(Assignment condition,
              Value nodeValue)
        Removes the probability for the value given the condition
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        nodeValue - the value for the node variable

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String newId)
        Replaces the node identifier with a new one
        Overrides:
        setId in class BNode
        Parameters:
        newId - the new identifier

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Value nodeValue)
               throws DialException
        Returns the probability associated with a specific value, according to the current distribution.

        The method assumes that the node is conditionally independent of every other node. If it isn't, one should use the getProb(condition, nodeValue) method instead.

        NB: the method should *not* be used to perform sophisticated inference, as it is not optimised and might lead to distorted results for very dependent networks

        Parameters:
        nodeValue - the value for the node
        Returns:
        its probability
        Throws:
        DialException

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment condition,
             Value nodeValue)
        Returns the probability associated with the conditional assignment and the node value, if one is defined.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        nodeValue - the value
        Returns:
        the associated probability
        Throws:
        DialException

      • sample

        public Value sample()
             throws DialException
        Returns a sample value for the node, according to the probability distribution currently defined.

        The method assumes that the node is conditionally independent of every other node. If it isn't, one should use the sample(condition) method instead.

        Returns:
        the sample value
        Throws:
        DialException - if no sample can be selected

      • sample

        public Value sample(Assignment condition)
             throws DialException
        Returns a sample value for the node, given a condition. The sample is selected according to the probability distribution for the node.
        Parameters:
        condition - the value assignment on conditional nodes
        Returns:
        the sample value
        Throws:
        DialException - if no sample can be selected

      • getValues

        public java.util.Set<Value> getValues()
        Returns a discrete set of values for the node. If the variable for the node has a continuous range, this set if based on a discretisation procedure defined by the distribution.
        Specified by:
        getValues in class BNode
        Returns:
        the discrete set of values

      • getNbValues

        public int getNbValues()
        Returns the number of values for the node
        Returns:
        the number of values

      • getDistrib

        public ProbDistribution getDistrib()
        Returns the probability distribution attached to the node
        Returns:
        the distribution

      • isCommitted

        public boolean isCommitted()
        Return true if the distribution of the current node is committed (that is, whether itself and its ancestors are all committed). An uncommitted distribution is for instance a partial word lattice.
        Returns:
        true if the node and its ancestors are fully committed, and false otherwise

      • getFactor

        public java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> getFactor()
        Returns the "factor matrix" mapping assignments of conditional variables + the node variable to a probability value.
        Specified by:
        getFactor in class BNode
        Returns:
        the factor matrix.

      • copy

        public ChanceNode copy()
                throws DialException
        Returns a copy of the node. Note that only the node content is copied, not its connection with other nodes.
        Specified by:
